meanings.definition: To surpass in firepower or ability to shoot.
meanings.sent1: The new army tanks are outgunning the old ones easily.
meanings.sent2: The police are outgunning the criminals with their advanced weapons.
meanings.sent3: During the paintball game, the kids were outgunning each other with laughter.
meanings.sent4: In the video game, the player was outgunning all the enemies with precision.
meanings.sent5: The hunters were outgunning the targets with accuracy and speed.

meanings.definition: To defeat or outdo in a competition or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The underdog team is outgunning the champions in this match.
meanings.sent2: She is outgunning her opponents in the race with her incredible speed.
meanings.sent3: The students were outgunning each other in the spelling bee competition.
meanings.sent4: The company is outgunning its competitors with innovative marketing strategies.
meanings.sent5: The superhero is outgunning the villains with his extraordinary powers.
